body_html:
Well, I have a LSTM model and some linear layers. I run the following code to freeze the LSTM part in order to continue training only the linear layers.

def freeze_layer(self, layer): for param in layer.parameters(): param.requires_grad = False

When it starts loss.backward() then the error occurs:
RuntimeError: inconsistent range for TensorList output

Without freezing the model works well.

Is that helpful?

Well, I have a LSTM model and some linear layers. I run the following code to freeze  the LSTM part in order to continue training only the linear layers.
def freeze_layer(self, layer): for param in layer.parameters(): param.requires_grad = False
When it starts loss.backward() then the error occurs:
RuntimeError: inconsistent range for TensorList output
Without freezing the model works well.
Is that helpful?
body:
Well, I have a LSTM model and some linear layers. I run the following code to freeze  the LSTM part in order to continue training only the linear layers. 

`def freeze_layer(self, layer):
    for param in layer.parameters():
        param.requires_grad = False`

When it starts `loss.backward()` then the error occurs:
RuntimeError: inconsistent range for TensorList output

Without freezing the model works well.

Is that helpful?
